page.title: 01AREA SOUTH OF STOKENCHURCH
page.content: Block offers a modest view of the renowned beauty of the Chiltern Hills. Woodland covers approximately 50% of area, whilst remainder is given over to farming. Where contours will allow, farming has been directed to crop cultivation or pasture. The pasture offers feeding for the considerable number of sheep with some cattle in area. Communication confined to minor roads, narrow lanes and tracks, which for the most part allow for single lane traffic only. Routes are punctuated by prepared places for passing. Block is riddled with Public Footpaths and is a favoured walking area. There is much wild life including inter alia: deer, pheasant and partridge. There are three small hamlets, Pishill, Southend, these are served by main water supply but no main drainage system.
